Title: Digital Twins: The Convergence of Multimedia Technologies
Abstract: Originally developed to improve manufacturing processes, digital twins are being redefined as digital replications of living as well as nonliving entities that enable data to be seamlessly transmitted between the physical and virtual worlds. Digital twins facilitate the means to monitor, understand, and optimize the functions of all physical entities and for humans provide continuous feedback to improve quality of life and well-being. © 1994-2012 IEEE.

Authors: Chhetri M.B., Krishnaswamy S., Loke S.W.
Title: Smart virtual counterparts for learning communities
Source title: Lecture Notes in Computer Science (including subseries Lecture Notes in Artificial Intelligence and Lecture Notes in Bioinformatics)
Abstract: Virtual learning environments can be greatly improved if they can provide location independent services and personalized interactions to the learning community. One way of achieving this is by having smart virtual counterparts to represent the users in the virtual learning environment. We propose that mobile agent technology is aptly suited for providing such smart virtual counterparts to represent learners, teachers and institutions in the virtual learning community. © Springer-Verlag 2004.

Title: Creating an embedded digital twin: Monitor, understand and predict device health failure
